group_1.textLeft: It's become clear now, the Automatic Purification@System is not stable.

group_1.textRight: Alina was able to paint "[textRed:a portrait@of a Magical Girl as a Witch]."
Ever since Mikoto Sena went berserk and@disappeared, we've attempted various fixes, but...
At this rate, it may only be a matter of time until@some Magical Girl is unable to release a Doppel,

group_1.textLeft: If we were able to properly collect all the impurities,
the very concept of becoming a Witch should@disappear.

group_1.textRight: I guess we need to tell everyone while@we think of new ways to handle this.

group_1.textLeft: The chances of becoming a Witch are very, very low.
There's no point in telling everyone while@there's nothing that can be done about it.

group_1.textRight: ...Certainly, it's better not to say anything if@we'd only be stirring up people's anxiety.

group_1.textLeft: But we do have to tell Ui and Big Sis...

group_1.textRight: Of course, considering the future risks.
Or were you thinking of hiding it from them?

group_1.textLeft: I'd rather not burden them with this.

group_1.textRight: ...I do agree with you on that,
but there's only so much that can@be done with regular maintenance.
We may have to look at making some more@fundamental changes over time...

group_1.narration: It all started with an order@from Touka and Nemu.
The details were simple: they wanted me to draw@"[textRed:a portrait of a Magical Girl as a Witch]."

Through repeated tests,@I discovered that by having Magical Girls@pour their power into my Labyrinth@and accumulating curses within it,@it would create paint that can@inspire visions of their eventual Witch.
This in itself is not emozionale for me.
These Witches...@The way that Magical Girls try to live their lives@having seen these cursed paintings,@THAT is the beauty that I,@Alina, am looking for.
That's why I've decided to turn this into a business.
"[textRed:Look within yourself.@Face your deepest fears...@and find your true resolve.]"
Today, Magical Girls from around the city have@once again gathered to receive their portraits.

group_1.textCenter: As some of you may know, there will be@no monetary charge for your portrait.
The asking price is simply that you@show me the struggle of your soul.
What sort of fire will this@knowledge light within you?
